p: The raw sequence data generated from 16S rRNA MiSeq sequencing were demultiplexed and quality-filtered using the QIIME (version 1.17) software package [ 27]. Gaps in each sequence were discarded from all samples to decrease noise by screening, filtering, and pre-clustering processes as described by a previous study [ 28]. Operational taxonomic units (OTUs) were clustered with a cut-off of value 97% similarity using UPARSE (version 7.1, http://drive5.com/uparse/), and chimeric sequences were identified and removed using UCHIME [ 29]. The representative sequence of each OTU was analyzed with the Ribosomal Database Project Classifier (RRID: SCR_006633) against the Silva (SSU119) 16S rRNA database at a confidence level of 90%.
